import React, {useState} from "react"; import axios from "axios"; import toast, { Toaster } from 'react-hot-toast'; const SignUp = () => { const [errors,setErrors] = useState([]); const [formDate, setFormDate] = useState({ name: "", email:"", number: "", password: "", address: "" }) const handleChanges = (e) => { setFormDate({ ...formDate, [e.target.name]: e.target.value }) } const handleFormSubmit = async (e) => { e.preventDefault(); try { // Send POST request to the backend API const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:3001/api/register', formDate); console.log(response.data); // Clear previous errors and show a success toast setErrors(''); toast.success(`You have been registered successfully!`); } catch (err) { // Check if the error response exists and includes validation details if (err.response && err.response.data && err.response.data.details) { const errorResponse = err.response.data.details; // Extract all validation messages and join them into a single string const validationMessages = errorResponse .map((detail) => detail.message) // Get each error message .join(', '); // Join messages with a comma separator setErrors(validationMessages); // Display the errors in a toast notification toast.error(`Validation Error: ${errors}`); } else if (err.response && err.response.data && err.response.data.msg) { // Show a general error message if `msg` exists in the response setErrors(err.response.data.msg); toast.error(`Error: ${err.response.data.msg}`); } else { // Handle any other unexpected errors (e.g., network errors) setErrors(`There was an error: ${err}`); toast.error(`This didn't work. Error: ${err.message}`); } console.log('Error occurred during form submission:', err); } }; return (
